Title: NANS urges Tinubu to increase budgetary allocation to N-HYPPADEC
Summary: The National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS) has called on President Bola Tinubu to increase budgetary allocations to N-HYPPADEC .

Title: Tinubu reappoints Marwa as NDLEA chairman
Summary: President Bola Ahmed Tinubu reappoints Mohammed Buba Marwa (rtd) as Chairman of the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) for another five-year term . Marwa, first appointed by former President Muhammadu Buhari in January 2021, previously .

Title: Ghana scraps Covid levy, cuts VAT to boost growth
Summary: Ghana has abolished its Covid-19 ‘Health Recovery Levy’ and reduced its value-added tax . Finance Minister Cassiel Ato Forson said the moves would ‘give back’ GHS 5.7 billion ($520 million)

Title: Wike vs naval officer: Military impunity and the shadow of 1966
Summary: In the face of chronic economic hardship and pervasive insecurity, Nigeria’s political landscape is displaying alarming symptoms of systemic breakdown . This dangerously echoes the decay preceding the collapse of the First Republic (1960–1966)

Title: Ohanaeze youths back Tinubu’s move for Ekweremadu’s return
Summary: The youth wing of the apex Igbo socio-cultural organisation, Ohanaeze Ndigbo Worldwide, has described the recent effort of the Nigerian Government towards the release of former Deputy Senate President, Senator Ike Ekweremadu, as heartwarming . Title: Plateau debunks claim of Gov Mutfwang’s defection to YPP
Summary: The government called on residents, supporters and stakeholders to disregard the rumour entirely and remain vigilant against politically motivated falsehoods . Governor Mutfwang is currently in office in the Plateau .

Title: Doctors in England launch strike over pay and jobs
Summary: Thousands of UK doctors in England on Friday launched a five-day strike over pay and training posts . It is the 13th walkout by medics since March 2023 .

Title: Benin’s govt on course to retain power in April election
Summary: Benin's electoral commission has approved just two candidates to stand in next April's presidential election . The ruling coalition is on course to retain power in the April election, opening the way for the ruling coalition .

Title: Strong FX inflows, tighter controls driving Naira stability, says CBN
Summary: Strong FX inflows, tighter controls driving Naira stability, says CBN . CBN says there is no longer unauthorised access to FX . "Whether you are a big man or not, we all go to the same market now for dollars," CBN said .
